00020 ;FILE DESCRIPTION:
00021 ; This file contains set up and interrupt service routines for
00022 ; I/O ports and External Interrupt pins connected to the switches and
00023 ; LEDs provided on the dsPICDEM2 development board.
00024 ;
00025 ;REVISION HISTORY:
00026 ;  $Log: INTx_IO_pins.c,v $

00032 
00033 //Pre-Processor Directives:
00034 #include <p30fxxxx.h>
00035 #include "system.h"
00036 #include "intx_io_pins.h"
00037 
00038 //Functions and Variables with Global Scope:
00039 
00040 
00041 //Functions:
00042 //INTx_IO_Init() sets up the INT0 and INT1 pins connected to the
00043 //switches S5 and S6, on the dsPICDEM2 board. It also sets port
00044 //pins, RB0 and RB1, as output pins to drive LEDs, D3 and D4.
00045 void INTx_IO_Init(void)
00046 {
00047 /*      //Set up Switches S5 and S6 as external interrupt input pins
00048         //S5 connected to INT0
00049         //S6 connected to INT1
00050         INTCON2 = 0x0003;       //Setup INT0-1 pins to interupt on falling edge
00051         IFS0bits.INT0IF = 0;    //Reset INT0 interrupt flag
00052         IEC0bits.INT0IE = 1;    //Enable INT0 Interrupt Service Routine
00053         IFS1bits.INT1IF = 0;    //Reset INT1 interrupt flag
00054         IEC1bits.INT1IE = 1;    //Enable INT1 Interrupt Service Routine
00055 */
00056         //Set up port pins RB0 and RB1 to drive the LEDs, D3 and D4
00057         //RB0 connected to D3
00058         //RB1 connected to D4
00059        
00060         LATBbits.LATB0 = 0;     //Clear Latch bit for RB0 port pin
00061         TRISBbits.TRISB0 = 0;   //Set the RB0 pin direction to be an output
00062         LATBbits.LATB1 = 0;     //Clear Latch bit for RB1 port pin
00063         TRISBbits.TRISB1 = 0;   //Set the RB1 pin direction to be an output
00064 
00065 }
00066 
00067 //_INT0Interrupt() is the INT0 interrupt service routine (ISR).
00068 //The routine must have global scope in order to be an ISR.
00069 //The ISR name is chosen from the device linker script.
00070 //On every INT0 interrupt event, the rate at which the LEDs blink is changed
00071 //by varying the prescaler on Timer1 between the states 1:1, 1:8, 1:64 & 1:256
00072 /*
00073 void __attribute__((__interrupt__, __no_auto_psv__)) _INT0Interrupt(void)
00074 {
00075         while (Switch_S5 == 1); //Wait in ISR until Switch S5 is released
00076 
00077                                 //Change Timer1 Prescaler to next value
00078                                 //in the sequence 1:1, 1:8, 1:64, 1:256
00079         if (T1CONbits.TCKPS == 3) T1CONbits.TCKPS = 0;
00080         else T1CONbits.TCKPS +=1;
00081 
00082         IFS0bits.INT0IF = 0;    //Clear the INT0 interrupt flag or else
00083                                 //the CPU will keep vectoring back to the ISR
00084 }
00085 */
00086 /*
00087 //_INT1Interrupt() is the INT1 interrupt service routine (ISR).
00088 //The routine must have global scope in order to be an ISR.
00089 //The ISR name is chosen from the device linker script.
00090 //On every other INT1 interrupt event, the state of LED D3 is flipped so that
00091 //the two LEDs are NOT ON simultaneously. On every other INT1 interrupt event,
00092 //the state of LED D3 is flipped back so that the two LEDs are ON simultaneously.
00093 void __attribute__((__interrupt__, __no_auto_psv__)) _INT1Interrupt(void)
00094 {
00095         while (Switch_S6 == 1); //Wait in ISR until Switch S5 is released
00096         LATBbits.LATB0 =~ LATBbits.LATB0; //Toggle LED D3
00097 
00098         IFS1bits.INT1IF = 0;    //Clear the INT0 interrupt flag or else
00099                                 //the CPU will keep vectoring back to the ISR
00100 }
00101 */
